Keywords: Asgardian , Cosmic , Deity , Herald , Ruler
Real Name: Thor Odinson
Special Powers
TARGETING: Hindering, Adjacent
POWER TAKEN, NOT GIVEN: When Thor clears 2 action tokens, give him a Power Cosmic token.
HERALD OF THUNDER: Charge, Running Shot, Sidestep.
POWER COSMIC BLEEDING THROUGH ENCHANTED URU: Thor has an additional target for each Power Cosmic token he has. // When Thor hits 3 or more characters, instead of normal damage, each hit target is dealt damage equal to his printed damage value.
THE GOD BLAST: STOP. Toughness. // When Thor targets a single opposing character, before rolling you may remove up to 3 Power Cosmic tokens to modify his damage by the amount of tokens removed.

June 19, 2022
Gensan
Only the five Combat Values (Speed, Attack, Defense, Damage, and Range) are affected by the Rule of Three. All other values, such as number of targets (bolts) a character has, are not restricted by it.
June 18, 2022
Dalandow
Targets aren't affected by the rule of 3?

January 3, 2022
Hatake Olee
This Herald Thor is an offensive beast, defensively, a little underwhelming. 19 Impervious is great and all, but when you look at pieces that are less points from this set like Sentry (150) and Demon in an Armor (50) that can reduce penetrating damage, would it have just been too much to give this Thor that same ability? As Pokolo mentioned, even a couple of stop clicks would of been a nice defensive help.

December 12, 2021
Xavolice
"When Thor hits 3 or more characters," does this mean if you gave him EE he could deal printed damage with it as long as he hit 3+ figures? Either way I love this guy! I feel like it is a balance 300 points. Fun to play, yet not unfair to play against. They don't all have to be as point efficient as CAAV!
November 25, 2021
Dalandow
As a life long die-hard Thor fan, this is extremely disappointing. His Cosmic Energy TA actively works against how you accumulate cosmic tokens, which at the earliest, you couldn't pull off his 3 target printed damage attack until turn 7. That's of course assuming he's on the board long enough to even do the attack. OMAs require a certain amount of survivability to even be worth using. This Thor has no way of reducing penetrating damage, has no way to heal himself, and only has one stop-click. He was my biggest want from the set. But after seeing that dial, I've lost any interest in trying to acquiring it.
November 3, 2021
bgreyloc
It's nice to see a 300-point piece that's actually a 300 point piece . not a 300 point piece that cost 150 points. This Thor looks like a lot of fun he has all the tools you need and you don't feel like you're cheating.
November 1, 2021
pokolo
if they were gonna make this guy a OMA, he could have used "can reduce penetrating damage" and/or a couple more STOP clicks scattered throughout his dial at each various point level, not just one at the end of the dial... i don't really see how he can hold his own in today's meta, even at this point level.
October 28, 2021
SpaceTitanium
Hate it. Just not worth 300 points and has the worst Thor costume in decades (if not ever). The sheer amount figures under a third his cost that can give him a bloody nose with little trouble basically destroys his playability in all but the slimmest of circumstances. Even if you want a ludicrously large tentpole/target you can do better, and most of the good ones even have the same KWs...
October 28, 2021
KCSuperman
I see a lot of negativity on this piece so far. But I’m going to say I give this piece a 4-5* rating. He isn’t as cost effective as the CAAV Thor, but I don’t think that makes him less capable. You got a figure here who doesn’t have to worry about making a ranged or close attack as he has answers to both, plus an additional 2 swing thanks to sidestep. Add on a base 13 attack and 6 damage and you have a very scary piece. He has a healthy 9 range as well. This thor is what I like to call “stat monster” because high base stats can be modified to even higher modified stats. Because he doesn’t have the utility of the caav thor at similar point levels, you will only want to run this piece at max power. From there you start adding in support such as empower and enhance, energy shield deflection (thanks green lantern), soul gem for healing and higher defenses. Watch out Superman Prime… someone is taking aim!
October 28, 2021
Emtemss
I think I'm going to have to agree with the general feelings on this particular Thor. He's wildly overcosted for what he brings to the able, especially in comparison with other Thors, and figures at his point cost. I wasn't expecting a God Doom level of power here, but something close would've been nice. As is the CAV Thor is better in nearly every regard, and for a drastically lower point cost. Still, I definitely want one for the collection, and because while he is not a particularly great Thor, he does look pretty fun. In large point games he will be a real fun beat stick flying around and blowing stuff up. He's just so simple, so vanilla, that he desperately needs cool support to enhance him. Dial is at best a 2-3/5 with a 5/5 sculpt.
October 27, 2021
Goop
I'm just not seeing it for 300pts. The stats are great for the first 3 clicks but i dont think thats worth an additional 100pts. His best ability is that special attack power so his 200pt line is clearly where you want to be at. Even at 200pts I'm not convinced he's much better than the Thor from the CAV set that 75pts cheaper. He's still good but a bit underwhelming for his cost.
